p: Since the nuclear factor kappa-B (NF-κB) regulates transcription of a cohort of genes implicated in immune and inflammatory responses [ 64] and its activation involves three major signaling pathways: (i) the canonical pathway, triggered by TNFα or IL-1; (ii) the non-canonical pathway, elicited by CD40 ligand or lymphotoxin β; and (iii) atypical signaling pathways, initiated by DNA-damage [ 65], its role in neuroinflammatory processes [ 66] was of interest. IL-1β is a crucial mediator of inflammatory responses [ 67], and its quantification by RT-qPCR was regarded as the method of choice [ 68].
